target_title: CUE files are created with absolute paths which causes troubles

note.body:
I just ran into this issue. Looking at the code it looks like a simple fix.

In brasero/plugins/audio2cue/burn-audio2cue.c line 425 

`line = g_strdup_printf ("FILE \"%s\" MOTOROLA\n", image);` 

`image` is a `gchar *` that has the full path. Instead of `image` we could have `g_path_get_basename(image)` to just have it be just the filename instead of the full path.

That may not be the only place in the code that needs a similar change as this case always uses `MOTOROLA` as the format descriptor and when I encountered this issue the format descriptor was `BINARY`.

target_title: Switch from libnotify to GNotification for sending notifications

note.body:
Note that from GNOME 47, the app icon will not be explicitly shown in the notification as below:

![brasero](/uploads/1885a62a93304610816727231e84db96/brasero.png)

but only as following.

![brasero-notification](/uploads/e81c2c2dea64a1bb844e26971ec41253/brasero-notification.png)

If icon needs to be displayed in the notification, we need to use `g_notification_set_icon (notification, '<optical symbolic icon name>');`

target_title: Switch from libnotify to GNotification for sending notifications

note.body:
From [g_application_get_default()](https://docs.gtk.org/gio/type_func.Application.get_default.html) doc:

_Normally there is only one GApplication per process and it becomes the default when it is created._

We're already using `GApplication` in brasero, but not in the perfect way. So, `g_application_get_default()` will return a valid `GApplication` instance after the `g_application_new()` call in [src/main.c#L105](https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/brasero/-/blob/master/src/main.c#L105), as shown below:

```
(gdb) bt 10
#0  g_application_set_default (application=application@entry=0x5555559e58d0 [GApplication]) at ../../../gio/gapplication.c:2934
#1  0x00007ffff6db8850 in g_application_constructed (object=0x5555559e58d0 [GApplication]) at ../../../gio/gapplication.c:1390
#2  0x00007ffff6c88c36 in g_object_new_internal (class=0x555555761200, params=0x7fffffffd8b0, n_params=2) at ../../../gobject/gobject.c:2657
#3  0x00007ffff6c8b6bb in g_object_new_internal (class=0x555555761200, params=0x7fffffffd8b0, n_params=2) at ../../../gobject/gobject.c:2923
#4  g_object_new_valist (object_type=<optimized out>, first_property_name=first_property_name@entry=0x7ffff6e318c0 "application-id", var_args=var_args@entry=0x7fffffffdb80) at ../../../gobject/gobject.c:2945
#5  0x00007ffff6c8ba0d in g_object_new (object_type=<optimized out>, first_property_name=first_property_name@entry=0x7ffff6e318c0 "application-id") at ../../../gobject/gobject.c:2418
#6  0x00007ffff6db6b09 in g_application_new (application_id=application_id@entry=0x55555559f0a1 "org.gnome.Brasero", flags=flags@entry=G_APPLICATION_FLAGS_NONE) at ../../../gio/gapplication.c:1890
#7  0x000055555556fbb5 in main (argc=<optimized out>, argv=<optimized out>) at ./src/main.c:105
```

note.body: The documentation for GApplication is not explicit on what a call to `g_application_get_default()` returns in this case, but it mentions that NULL is a possible return value, and this patch does not port to GApplication for managing application lifetime, so presumably https://gitlab.gnome.org/GNOME/brasero/-/merge_requests/35 is a prerequisite.

target_title: Brasero hangs while trying to burn audio CD

note.body:
> IIUC, the general idea is to move `brasero` fully towards `libburnia` only, in future.

Since libburnia is actively being maintained, I think we should give high priority to [libburnia](https://dev.lovelyhq.com/libburnia/web/wiki/Home) plugin among plugins in brasero, so it will be picked in most use cases.

target_title: Brasero hangs while trying to burn audio CD

note.body:
I was having this same issue of Brasero just freezing as soon as I hit "Burn". Following [these](https://ubuntu-mate.community/t/brasero-freezes-at-starting-to-record/17069/18) directions fixed the problem for me, and I can now burn music on a CD normally.

Commands from the link that fixed the issue:
```
sudo chmod 4711 /usr/bin/cdrdao
sudo chmod 4711 /usr/bin/wodim
sudo chmod 0755 /user/bin/growisfs
```
